meanings.definition: Not producing the desired result; unsuccessful.
meanings.sent1: The old flashlight was ineffective at lighting up the dark room.
meanings.sent2: The medicine was ineffective in curing the patient's illness.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella was ineffective at keeping the sun off, but it made a great makeshift parasol.
meanings.sent4: Her attempts to fix the leaky faucet were as ineffective as trying to stop a waterfall with a bucket.
meanings.sent5: The broken compass was so ineffective that it led them in circles in the dense forest.

meanings.definition: Lacking the ability or power to produce a desired effect.
meanings.sent1: The worn-out shoes were ineffective at protecting his feet from the sharp rocks.
meanings.sent2: The weak signal was ineffective in connecting the phone call.
meanings.sent3: The scarecrow was ineffective at scaring away the birds, but it did make a great perch for them.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as ineffective as whispers in a noisy crowd.
meanings.sent5: The rusty lock was so ineffective that the door swung open with a gentle push.
